thing-type.label: SES FS-ZW Plug Actuator
thing-type.description: Plug Actuator<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtSmart outlet with energy monitoring.</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtThe inclusion process is controlled by the central unit – refer to the documentation for the central unit.</p&gt <ol&gt<li&gtPlug the plug actuator into a fixed mains outlet with grounding contacts (CEE 7/4).</li&gt <li&gtStart “Inclusion” mode on the chosen central unit.</li&gt <li&gtPress the button on the plug actuator 3 times within a period of around 2 seconds.</li&gt </ol&gt<p&gtThe Status LED lights up white.</p&gt <p&gtDuring the next 5 seconds, the wireless connection is established and the inclusion process for linking the plug actuator to the central unit is performed.</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtThe exclusion process is controlled by the central unit – refer to the documentation for the central unit.</p&gt <ol&gt<li&gtMake sure that no device is plugged into the plug actuator.</li&gt <li&gtStart “Exclusion” mode on the chosen central unit.</li&gt <li&gtPress the button on the plug actuator 3 times within a period of around 2 seconds.</li&gt </ol&gt<p&gtThe Status LED lights up white.</p&gt <p&gtThe exclusion process for disconnecting the plug actuator from the central unit runs for the next 5 seconds. The Status LED flashes white 3x once the exclusion process has been successfully completed.</p&gt

parameter.name: config_3_2
parameter.label: 3: Energy maximum report time
parameter.description: Maximum time between two energy values, independently of changes in the value

parameter.name: config_4_2
parameter.label: 4: Power minimum report time
parameter.description: Minimum time between two (non-requested) power values

parameter.name: config_5_2
parameter.label: 5: Power maximum report time
parameter.description: Maximum time between two power values, independently of changes in the value

parameter.name: config_6_2
parameter.label: 6: Energy delta value
parameter.description: Minimum change required for a new energy value to be transmitted.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe transmission must take place in the time window between parameter 2 and 3.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_7_2
parameter.label: 7: Power delta value
parameter.description: Minimum change required for a new power value to be transmitted.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe transmission must take place in the time window between parameter 4 and 5</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_8_1
parameter.label: 8: Safety shutdown configuration
parameter.description: Behaviour in the event of a safety shutdown<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe plug actuator remains OFF after 3x safety shutdowns.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_9_1_wo
parameter.label: 9: Reset of overcurrent shutdown
parameter.description: Activation despite 3x safety shutdown<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt Activation despite 3x safety shutdown (parameter 8 = 1)</p&gt <p&gt A reset request (“Set” command) is normally executed very quickly, as a result of which a query (“Get” command) for this parameter usually returns the response “0” (no reset) for this parameter. In some cases, this can be interpreted incorrectly. Consequently, this parameter should be treated only as “write only”. </p&gt</p&gt
